Package org.gruth.tools

This package is for a "lightweight" use of GRU libraries (and so should be delivered in a separate jar).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SingleTestReport.Reporter
    Implementations publish SingleTestReports.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    PackCommons
    Common data and utilities for this package.
    SimpleAssertion
    Many instances of this report element may be gathered into a more global test report.
    SimplePublisher
    A simple SingleTestReport.Reporter that publishes reports on the standard output (for reports that are ok) or standard Error (for reports that are less or equals to WARNING).
    SingleTestReport
    This class is part of an abstract layer that enables any java code to publish GRU-like reports (though these may not be exactly gru reports).
    SingleTestReport.ReportMap
    local implementation of LinkeHashMap
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Diag
    This enum states diagnostics linked to an assertion.

Package org.gruth.tools Description

This package is for a "lightweight" use of GRU libraries (and so should be delivered in a separate jar). The main idea is to let programmers define a "single test unit" that may gather different assertions. A "single test unit" should be something linked to the test of a single purpose (example: test a given constructor or method evocation)

so:

  • such a test unit should be uniquely identified. it's up to the developer to decide which combination of data is unique using: name of test, class, name of code being invoked, identification of parameters ,... Though there is no code in GRU to manage those tests results in a database and to keep a history of runs (and compare with previous executions of the same tests) developers are encouraged to write this kind of utility code (and, may be, share with other users of the library).
  • The core class is SingleTestReport. Most of the time only one instance of this class should be created for each "single test unit" (using one of the factory methods). This class may gather information about the class, the invoked code name, current object, invocation arguments, various assertions (instances of class SimpleAssertion), caught Exception, and any data that the developer see fit to report.
  • once an instance of SingleTestReport if filled then it should be published. (by default the last unpublished instance is published when a new one is created). Publication is handled by one or more SingleTestReport.Reporter. (see the corresponding javadoc to learn how to write and deploy such a service).
